newsitem.title: GERMANY: Buba seen leaving rates steady Thursday - poll.
newsitem.headline: Buba seen leaving rates steady Thursday - poll.

text.p: Following are the results of a poll of 10 economists on the expected outcome of this week's Bundesbank council meeting. The poll was conducted on Tuesday.
1. Will the Bundesbank cut its leading interest rates this week?
Yes 0
No 10
2. Will there be a further cut in the discount and lombard rates later this year?
Yes 1
No 9
3. Will there be another fixed tender at 3.00 percent this Thursday?
Yes 10
No 0
Detailed results of the poll as follows:
Economist 1. 2. 3.
Jochen Schober, Helaba, Frankfurt No. No. Yes.
Alison Cottrell, Paine Webber, London No. No. Yes.
Alwin Schenk, Sal.Oppenheim, Frankfurt No. No . Yes.
Hans-Jrg Naumer, Societe Generale,Ffm No. No. Yes.
Nick Stamenkovic, DKB Int, London No. Yes. Yes.
Petra Koehler, Dresdner Bank, Ffm No. No. Yes.
Keith Edmonds, IBJ Int., London No. No. Yes.
Stefan Schneider, Banque Paribas, Ffm No. No. Yes.
Heinrich Schaumburg, BfG Bank, Ffm No. No. Yes.
Thomas Kull, West LB, Duesseldorf No. No. Yes.
--Frankfurt Newsroom, +49 69 756525
